meanings.definition: In a manner that is clearly evident or remarkable.
meanings.sent1: She ran signally fast in the race.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display was signally beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The cat signally knocked over the vase, pretending it was an accident.
meanings.sent4: His kindness shone signally in a world full of selfishness.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience was signally evident in the way she helped each student.

meanings.definition: To make a signal or indication.
meanings.sent1: He signally waved his hand to catch the waiter's attention.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse signally guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel signally tapped on the window to ask for more nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her smile signally indicated her approval of the plan.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock signally announced the start of a new day.
